about_summary:
üëã I am Jihoon Chae, a Full-stack Developer who builds and completes fully functional services using diverse tech stacks.

about_sections.title: User-Centric Front-end Development
details: Focused on designing UI for web and mobile platforms using React and React Native, prioritizing user flow and interaction.
In my graduation project, I improved the UI/UX based on actual user surveys and redesigned the search/category structure to enhance usability.

Concentrated on building 'easy-to-use' services rather than just 'good-looking' screens through TypeScript, responsive layouts, and performance optimization (lazy loading, eliminating unnecessary re-renders).

about_sections.title: A Problem-Solving Mindset
details: I make it a principle to improve upon the regrets of previous projects in my next endeavor.
Experienced in full-scale refactoring from JavaScript to TypeScript, replacing slow build environments with Vite, and structurally resolving duplicate data/logic issues.
Through this process, I naturally developed a keen sense for code quality, maintainability, and performance performance.

about_sections.title: Data-Driven Decision Making
details: I rely on data rather than intuition. In my graduation project, I adjusted feature priorities based on user survey analysis.
In personal projects, I improved UI and data flows by analyzing API response structures and user behavior patterns.
Through data analysis projects on YouTube and IMDB, I gained experience in interpreting data and connecting it to insights, realizing the importance of evidence-based development.

about_conclusion:
I aim for development that solves problems for users, not just technology for technology's sake.
I aspire to be a developer who learns quickly in new environments, constantly thinks about better structures, and grows continuously.

projects.title: Nobel Prize Archive: Exploring Human Intelligence (TS Refactoring & AI Translation)
projects.description:
**Personal Project | Frontend (React ¬∑ TypeScript ¬∑ Vite)**

A comprehensive web archive for exploring Nobel Prize data from 1901 to the present. Beyond simple data visualization, this project maximizes user experience through **real-time AI translation** and **data cleansing logic**. It is built as a 'Product-ready' service, considering everything from UI/UX to **Technical SEO** for actual user discoverability.

### üöÄ What I built
- **Legacy Modernization**: Fully refactored a CRA + JS environment to **Vite + TypeScript**, achieving a 95% reduction in build time and ensuring robust type safety.
- **AI-Powered Multi-language Support**: Integrated **Google Translate API** to provide real-time Korean translations for English-only 'Motivation' data.
- **On-demand Profile Extension**: Developed an interactive accordion UI using **Framer Motion** to fetch and display detailed laureate bios (birth, affiliations, etc.) only when requested, optimizing initial load performance.

### üéØ Technical Focus
- **Strict Type System**: Eliminated `any` types by designing precise interfaces for complex nested API responses, reducing runtime errors by over 95%.
- **Advanced Data Cleansing**: Implemented regex-based pre-processing to handle irregular public API data (e.g., date formats like '-00-00' or missing fields), ensuring UI consistency.
- **Dark Glassmorphism UX**: Engineered a **transparent glass-textured search system** that maintains high legibility and aesthetic appeal against high-resolution dark backgrounds.
- **Technical SEO Strategy**: Maximized search engine indexing efficiency and CTR via Sitemap.xml, Google Search Console integration, and Open Graph optimization.

### üí° Takeaway
- Mastered frontend data pre-processing skills by transforming inconsistent public API data into high-value information.
- Recognized the critical impact of SEO and accessibility (Translation) on a service's actual discoverability and usability beyond mere functional implementation.
- Deepened understanding of system architecture scalability and maintenance efficiency through the full refactoring process.

projects.title: Spring Boot Based Web Board Application
projects.description:
**Role: Backend Development**

Built a backend for a web application with post, comment, and member management features using Spring Boot and JPA. Focused on understanding the differences between MVC and REST API architectures.

### What I did
- Designed and implemented Board/Comment/Like features
- Applied Spring Security for authentication and session-based authorization
- Designed a structure supporting both REST API and MVC
- Built and verified testing environments using Postman

### Main Features
- **Member**: Login/Signup, session-based auth, BCrypt password encryption
- **Board**: CRUD for posts, integrated comments/likes on detail pages
- **Security**: Handled authentication/authorization via Spring Security

### Technical Focus
- **MVC + REST API Coexistence**: Managed authentication conflicts by separating Security FilterChains and controlling priorities
- **Authentication Troubleshooting**: Deepened understanding of Spring Security internals by resolving context issues in test environments
- **Structural Design**: Ensured data integrity through entity relationship design, JPA utilization, and transaction flow management

### Takeaway
- Learned the rationale for architectural choices by experiencing the limitations of MVC and the advantages of REST APIs
- Established the concept of 'Data Contracts' with clients through API-first design
- Strengthened security expertise by understanding Spring Security filter chains and authentication flows

projects.title: Spring Boot Based RESTful Board API
projects.description:
**Role: Backend Development**

Designed and implemented a fully RESTful API service using Spring Boot and JWT. Focused on building a backend structure close to real-world environments through JWT auth, permission logic, and DRY-compliant refactoring.

### What I did
- Implemented JWT-based authentication/authorization systems
- Developed APIs for Members, Posts, Comments, and Likes
- Enhanced security through author validation for data modification
- Refactored to eliminate redundant logic and improve structure

### Main Features
- **Authentication**: JWT token issuance and filter-based authentication
- **Board API**: Applied RESTful principles to all board-related CRUD operations
- **Permissions**: Logic to verify ownership before allowing data updates/deletions

### Technical Focus
- **Spring Security + JWT**: Designed stateless authentication flows using Custom FilterChains
- **@AuthenticationPrincipal**: Securely passed user info from the Security Context to controllers
- **Ownership Validation**: Implemented internal business logic to ensure secure data modification
- **JPA + MySQL**: Designed data mappings considering production DB environments

### Takeaway
- Fully understood token-based authentication beyond theory by implementing it from scratch
- Experienced a professional backend development process involving 'security-integrated API design'
- Realized that refactoring and structural cleanup are directly linked to the 'lifespan' of the code

projects.title: Real-time Multi-language Translation Chat
projects.description:
**Role: Full-stack Development**

A chat platform where users of different languages can exchange real-time translated messages using Socket.IO and Google Translation API.

### What I Did
- Designed and implemented real-time bidirectional communication using Socket.IO
- Integrated Google Translation API with auto-language detection and translation logic
- Ensured data persistence for chat logs using MongoDB
- Built user-centric real-time chat UI/UX and responsive web design

### Main Features
- **Real-time Translation**: Automatic translation to the recipient's language upon message input
- **Chat Room Management**: Room creation, join/leave notifications, and real-time participant lists
- **Message History**: Loading previous logs from MongoDB with infinite scroll

### Technical Focus
- **Communication Optimization**: Minimized latency by efficiently separating Socket.IO event handlers
- **API Integration & Error Handling**: Implemented stable exception handling for external API (Google Cloud) timeouts and quotas
- **Data Modeling**: Designed efficient schemas for messages, language info, and timestamps using NoSQL flexibility
- **Asynchronous Processing**: Controlled async flows between high-volume message traffic and API translation processing

### Takeaway
- Deeply understood real-time data processing mechanisms via WebSockets
- Acquired practical skills in integrating external Cloud services (GCP) into production
- Strengthened full-stack service design and troubleshooting capabilities
